Package logic

Class User

java.lang.Object
logic.Person
logic.User
public class User extends Person
Represents a user with additional credentials such as username and password, extending the Person class. This class also manages a table of contacts associated with the user, offering functionality to manage user details and their contacts.
Author:
Leuti Michele

  • Constructor Details

    • User

      public User(String[] userInfo)
      Constructs a User instance with basic information and initializes a new table of contacts. Validates the username and password for non-emptiness and password complexity.
      Parameters:
      userInfo - An array containing the user's name, surname, username, and password.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If any validation fails.

    • User

      public User(String[] userInfo, ArrayList<Person> contacts, String id)
      Constructs a User instance with basic information, a list of existing contacts, and a specific ID. Initializes the user's table of contacts either with existing contacts or as a new table.
      Parameters:
      userInfo - An array containing the user's name, surname, username, and password.
      contacts - An ArrayList of Person objects representing existing contacts.
      id - The user's unique identifier.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If any validation fails.

    • setPassword

      public void setPassword(String password)
      Sets the password of this user after validating for complexity requirements.
      Parameters:
      password - The new password to be set.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the password does not meet complexity requirements.

    • checkPassword

      public boolean checkPassword(String password)
      Checks if a given password matches the user's current password.
      Parameters:
      password - The password to check against the user's password.
      Returns:
      True if the passwords match; false otherwise.

    • checkIfValidPassword

      public static boolean checkIfValidPassword(String password)
      Validates a password against a set of complexity requirements.
      Parameters:
      password - The password to validate.
      Returns:
      True if the password meets the complexity requirements; otherwise, throws an exception.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the password does not meet the complexity requirements.
